title: Vanessa Hudgens' Baby Bump Album Before Welcoming 2nd Child
description: Vanessa Hudgens is pregnant with her and husband Cole Tucker's second child, sharing baby bump photos on Instagram
content:
Vanessa Hudgens is showing off her baby bump as she prepares to become a mom of two.

Hudgens announced that she and husband Cole Tucker are expecting their second child together in July 2025, debuting her growing bump while posing for an Instagram photo shoot.

“Round two!!!!” Hudgens and Tucker captioned a joint Instagram post at the time.

Hudgens has since been documenting her flawless maternity style on her social media account, sharing swimsuit photos, glam looks and more.

The High School Musical star and the professional baseball player started dating in 2020 after meeting during a Zoom meditation session. They got married in Tulum, Mexico, three years later and welcomed their first child, whose name and sex have not been publicly shared, in July 2024.

“Mom, Dad and baby are happy and healthy,” Hudgens wrote via her Instagram Stories at the time, calling her delivery a “special time.”

Keep scrolling for more of Hudgens’ best maternity moments while expecting her second baby:
summary: Vanessa Hudgens is expecting her second child with husband, professional baseball player, with whom she met in 2000. The couple have been documenting their pregnancy on social media and sharing their experiences. The child's name and gender have not yet been publicly disclosed.
shortSummary: Vanessa Hudgens reveals she is expecting her second child, and shares her Instagram profile with her husband's equally successful debut.

scraped_sources.text:
Vanessa Hudgens and her husband, Cole Tucker, are expecting their second baby.
“Round two!!!!,” Hudgens, 36, wrote via Instagram on Saturday, July 12, announcing the news by sharing a carousel of maternity photos.
In the snaps, Hudgens and Tucker, 29, twinned in white as they posed outside. The MLB star jokingly pointed to his wife’s bare baby bump.
Hudgens and Tucker’s celebrity friends toasted the forthcoming arrival in the comments.
“Omg!!!!!!!! Congrats,” fellow Disney Channel alum Aly Michalka replied, while Allison Holker and Alexandra Shipp each sent a flurry of red heart emojis.
Jenna Dewan, for her part, added, “Ohhhhh congratulations my love!!”
Hudgens’ former Broadway costar Corey Cott also responded, commenting, “Congrats V!”
Nearly two weeks before sharing her pregnancy news, Hudgens called Tucker her “best friend” in a birthday tribute.
“Happy birthday to my best friend/lover/partner in life,” she wrote via Instagram on July 3. “@cotuck you’re everything to meeeeeee. No one does it better.”
Tucker, for his part, replied, “You’re the best mama thank you ❤️.”
The High School Musical star and Tucker have been together since fall 2020, meeting over a Zoom-led meditation session. They tied the knot three years later in an intimate ceremony held in Tulum, Mexico.
“I also knew I wanted to get married somewhere warm, and our window for getting married was so small because Cole’s [baseball] season is very long,” she recalled to Vogue in 2023. “I felt like ‘Mexico it is!’ I also wanted somewhere very spiritual. So I went to the hotel and got a really long tour, where I myself was not doing well, I was so hot and felt like I was going to faint. At the end of this very long tour, I was like ‘Where would we have our ceremony?’ and they were like ‘Oh, that would be at our museum’ and they said, ‘It’s 45 minutes into the jungle.’ I was thinking, ‘Okay, that sounds aggressive, but I guess I’ll give it a try.’”
She added, “I felt like I was transported to some kind of utopia, unlike anything I had ever been to before. It was whimsical and magical, and I just fell in love.”
Hudgens revealed the next year that she was pregnant with the couple’s first child, debuting her baby bump at the 2024 Oscars. The actress gave birth in July 2024.
“Mom, Dad and baby are happy and healthy,” Hudgens gushed via Instagram story, calling it a “special time.”
Hudgens and Tucker have not publicly shared the name or sex of their eldest child.

Vanessa Hudgens found The One in Cole Tucker.
The pair first sparked romance rumors when they were spotted holding hands in November 2020, less than one year after Hudgens split from longtime love Austin Butler. Hudgens and Tucker went Instagram official in honor of Valentine’s Day the following year.
“Me and Cole met on a Zoom meditation group. Very random, yes,” Hudgens told Entertainment Tonight in April 2021. “Zoom, you’ve got to love it. He’s just kind of perfect for me. I am [happy]. I really am.”
One month later, Hudgens elaborated on how she made the first move when she originally met the baseball player. “I fully just slid into his DMs and was like, ‘Hey, it was nice to meet you.’ So I think there is no shame in making the first move,” she said on The Drew Barrymore Show in May 2021.
Scroll down to relive Hudgens and Tucker’s relationship:

Vanessa Hudgens has welcomed her first baby with husband Cole Tucker.
Multiple outlets reported the news on Wednesday, July 3. The baby’s birthdate, name and sex are not yet revealed.
Us Weekly has reached out to Hudgens’ team for comment.
The actress, 35, and the baseball player, who turned 28 on Wednesday, were spotted leaving a hospital in Santa Monica earlier in the day.
Hudgens revealed her pregnancy in March, debuting her baby bump on the red carpet at the 2024 Oscars. She wore a form-fitting black turtleneck Vera Wang gown as she rested her hands on her belly.
“[Cole] treats her better than any guy she has been with. They are in a really good place,” a source exclusively told Us Weekly at the time. “With marriage and a baby, she is ready for the next phase of life.”
Hudgens began dating Tucker in 2020 after they met on a meditation Zoom during the COVID-19 pandemic. The couple got engaged in December 2022 and tied the knot in Mexico one year later.
Prior to the nuptials, an insider told Us in June 2023 that Hudgens and Tucker both wanted “a family now and that’s what’s driving them toward getting married [soon],” noting that she had “no doubt” he would make a great father.
Months later, Hudgens shot down speculation that she was expecting amid her October 2023 bachelorette party in Aspen, Colorado. “Not pregnant so y’all can stop,” she responded in the comments section of her Instagram post.
In March, Hudgens reflected on the upsetting rumors. “I was like, ‘That is so rude. I’m sorry, I don’t wear Spanx every day and, like, am a real woman and have a real body,’” she said on the “She Pivots” podcast. “I’m literally celebrating one of the happiest times of my life, and you guys are just gonna make me feel fat. That’s great. Thanks.”
Hudgens then urged fellow women not to “make assumptions … in all aspects of life, but especially over other women’s bodies,” adding, “We deal with so much with other people trying to control our bodies, let’s not make assumptions over other women’s bodies as well.”
While Hudgens originally had a different timeline in mind for motherhood, she insisted in September 2022 that she handled the change in plans well.
“I always thought I would be married at 25 because that’s when my mom got married, and then when that didn’t happen, I was like, ‘Oh, OK, so we’re just going to shift everything back a bit,’” she told Nylon. “I always thought that around 36, 37 is when I would want to have kids, and that still plays. I don’t feel panicked about it.”

Vanessa Hudgens and her husband, Cole Tucker, always knew that they wanted to have children.
“They both want a family now, and that’s what’s driving them toward getting married [soon],” a source exclusively told Us Weekly in June 2023, ahead of the couple’s wedding in Tulum, Mexico.
One year after Hudgens and Tucker tied the knot, the actress revealed at the 2024 Oscars that they were expecting their first baby.
“Cole hasn’t left Vanessa’s side throughout her pregnancy,” a second insider told Us in April 2024. “It’s only making her fall even more in love with him. She knows Cole will make an amazing father.”
The High School Musical star gave birth in July 2024, though the pair did not immediately reveal their child’s name or sex. The next year, Hudgens confirmed she’s expecting again.
“Round two!!!!,” she wrote via Instagram in July 2025, sharing photos of her bare baby bump.
Keep scrolling for everything Hudgens has said about pregnancy and motherhood through the years:
All About Relaxing During Pregnancy
Hudgens has long been informally hailed the queen of Coachella, though she opted to skip the music festival when she was pregnant with her first baby.
“The walking sounded aggressive,” she quipped to Bustle in April 2024. “It’s a lot of walking.”
Replacing Shoes
During her first pregnancy, Hudgens found that her shoe size changed.
“I feel like most of you know when you’re pregnant, your feet swell up,” she said in an Instagram video in March 2025. “But what I didn’t know is that sometimes your feet stay swelled up and your foot grows an entire size. That’s what happened to me.”
As a result, Hudgens said she needed to “replace [her] entire shoe closet.”
‘Happy and Healthy’ Arrival
After Hudgens gave birth to her first child, she gave a brief update on the little one’s arrival.
“Mom, Dad and baby are happy and healthy,” she wrote via her Instagram Stories in July 2024, calling it a “special time.”
Showing Her Projects to Her Kids
Hudgens already can’t wait for her children to discover her most beloved projects, including the High School Musical and The Princess Switch franchises.
“I’ll show my kids all my work,” Hudgens told E! News in May 2024. “That’s why I chose things along the way in my career. I wanted to make sure that when I did have kids, there would be something for them to watch at every age.”

Vanessa Hudgens
Born in California in December 1988, Hudgens’ first major role was in the 2004 sci-fi adventure film Thunderbirds. The actress/singer’s most lucrative film role to date has been that of Gabriella Montez in the Emmy Award-winning High School Musical film franchise.
Hudgens also pursued a solo music career, and her album V debuted at No. 24 on the U.S. charts. She and then boyfriend Zac Efron won Best Chemistry at the Teen Choice Awards for their roles in High School Musical (2006). In September 2007, however, Hudgens’ public image took a hit when nude photos of the starlet surfaced online. Undeterred, Hudgens released her sophomore album, Identified, in July 2008 after wrapping High School Musical 2.
Hudgens continued to find success in musical theater, with a lead role in Gigi on Broadway. She later starred in two live TV musical adaptations as Rizzo in Grease: Live and Maureen in Rent: Live.
Hudgens added producing to her resume with the 2015 web series #15SecondScare. She also produced her Netflix film The Knight Before Christmas (2019) and The Princess Switch sequels.
Hudgens received backlash after fans called her response to the coronavirus pandemic insensitive in March 2020 and she apologized shortly after.
Offscreen, Hudgens has dated a few famous faces. After more than five years of dating, Hudgens and Efron called it quits in December 2010. Hudgens and Austin Butler started dating in 2011. The couple split in January 2020 after nine years together. The actress and Cole Tucker sparked romance rumors in November 2020. The pair confirmed their relationship in February 2021. Hudgens and Tucker were wed in Late 2023.
Hudgens announced in March 2024 that she was pregnant with her and Tucker’s first child. She gave birth in July 2024. The next year, the couple confirmed they are expecting Baby No. 2.

argos_summary: Vanessa Hudgens and her husband Cole Tucker are expecting their second child, as announced in July 2025 through a series of maternity photos on Instagram. The couple, who married in Tulum, Mexico, in 2023, welcomed their first child in July 2024. Hudgens has been sharing her maternity journey and style on social media, celebrating this new chapter in their family life.
